trees.layout

Class LayoutAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • trees.layout.LayoutAlgorithm

  • public class LayoutAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal core class for analyzing a given tree. Only to be used within the TreePanel. This is basically an implementation of Walker JQ II. A node-positioning algorithm for general trees. Software-Practice and Experience 1990; 20(7):685-705. with some adaption for Java.
    Author:
    Marcus Deininger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LayoutAlgorithm() 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean positionTree(Style style, Node root)
      Executes a full positioning algorithm on the given tree.
      boolean recalculateTree(Style style, Node root)
      Executes a recalculation on the given tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LayoutAlgorithm

        public LayoutAlgorithm()

    • Method Detail

      • positionTree

        public boolean positionTree(Style style,
                   Node root)
        Executes a full positioning algorithm on the given tree.
        Parameters:
        style - - The style for displaying. This contains information about element separation, orientation, font, etc.
        root - - The root of the tree to be displayed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the positioning succeeded.

      • recalculateTree

        public boolean recalculateTree(Style style,
                      Node root)
        Executes a recalculation on the given tree. This can be done when only the orientation of the tree has changed.
        Parameters:
        style - - The style for displaying. This contains information about element separation, orientation, font, etc.
        root - - The root of the tree to be displayed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the positioning succeeded.
